alert.note: Alert for Caroline; Eastern Essex; Eastern Hanover; Eastern King William; Eastern King and Queen; Richmond; Western Essex; Western Hanover; Western King William; Western King and Queen (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued November 21 at 11:24PM EST by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...GUSTY SHOWERS WILL IMPACT NORTHWESTERN KING AND QUEEN...WESTERN RICHMOND...SOUTHEASTERN CAROLINE...SOUTHEASTERN HANOVER...KING WILLIAM AND ESSEX COUNTIES THROUGH MIDNIGHT EST... At 1124 PM EST, Doppler radar was tracking gusty showers along a line extending from near Newtown to Mechanicsville. Movement was east at 55 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Reduced visibility and minor flooding possible. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Champlain, Newtown, Manquin, Beulahville, Studley, and Aylett around 1130 PM EST. Saint Stephens Church around 1135 PM EST. King William, Tappahannock, Millers Tavern, and Newland around 1140 PM EST. Warsaw, Stevensville, and Dunnsville around 1145 PM EST. King And Queen Court House and Center Cross around 1150 PM EST. Other locations impacted by these storms include Beazley, Enfield, Elevon, Upright, Ino, Etna Mills, Epworth, Rose Garden, Biscoe, and Lyells. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
